snippet: The Federal Reserve said that it would gradually end its bond-buying program during 2014 but strengthened plans to hold short-term interest rates near zero.
abstract: Federal Reserve says it will gradually end its bond-buying program during 2014 in modest first step toward unwinding broader stimulus campaign as officials gain confidence in economy's growth; seeks to offset concerns of pulling back too soon by strengthening plans to hold short-term interest rates near zero.

byline.contributor: Nelson D. Schwartz contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve said that it would gradually end its bond-buying program during 2014 but strengthened plans to hold short-term interest rates near zero.

headline.main: Fed to Start Unwinding Its Stimulus Next Month
headline.print_headline: Fed to Start Unwinding Its Stimulus Next Month
